article:
It was the first weekend after Christmas and all I wanted to do was lie on the sofa and watch TV. However , I had two lawns to mow   .Too bad ! I   _  
Five years ago my 72-year-old next-door neighbor fell down in the driveway. We both   _  to be working on our lawns that day.  _  for us ,we'd
stopped to chat. I  _  Glen before his head hit the ground.
He lay semiconscious   in my   _  until the ambulance arrived .
I rode with Glen and his wife , Grace , to the hospital. Over the next few weeks , I cut his lawn.Glen   _  fully recovered. He could hardly walk.Within two years , he was dead. I
had  _  for Grace .With nobody else to help ,I 'd
been attending her lawn  ever since  . I liked to think someone would
take care of my lawn for my  _  if anything like that
happened to me .
But that didn't make the promise any   _  . I needed to buy twice as much gas--not  _  . Besides, my old mower regularly  broke down  .Grace let me use
Glen's lawnmower and chipped in  for   _  , but eventually that mower
also started going wrong. I admired the fancy new models  _  .
"Light as a feather." "Almost does the job itself." But it was  _  me
right now.
"Glen would do it for me," I   _  myself as I walked to Grace's  _  .Maybe I just
didn't want to spend the post-Christmas day cutting grass with that terrible
mower,  _  I wanted to let Grace down even less.
I opened the garage door.The old lawnmower was  _  . In its place sat the latest mower on the
market.  _  to it ,a sign read, "Merry Christmas, Joe. Hope you
like your new lawnmower. " One gentle pull of the starter rope ,and it came to
life. It was Christmas all over again.
